suit.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a set of clothes made of the same material, usually including a jacket with trousers or a skirt
suit.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She was wearing a black trouser suit.
suit.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
suit.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Johnson has filed suit against her.
suit.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a man, especially a manager, who works in an office and who has to wear a suit when he is at work
suit.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I bought myself a mobile phone and joined the other suits on the train to the City.
suit.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: one of the four types of cards in a set of playing cards
suit.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to be acceptable, suitable, or convenient for a particular person or in a particular situation
suit.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Whatever your reason for borrowing, we have the loan that suits your needs.
There’s a range of restaurants to suit all tastes.
There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
We have gifts to suit every pocket  (=of all prices).
Either steak or chicken would suit me fine.
The climate there will suit you down to the ground  (=suit you very well).
She had the ability to suit her performances to the audience.
suit.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: clothes, colours etc that suit you make you look attractive
suit.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Jill’s new hairstyle doesn’t really suit her.
suit.translation[1].definitions[1].note_: Suit is never passive in this meaning

suit.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a case brought to a court of law by a private person or company, not by the police or government
suit.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Ms. Sobel filed a suit, claiming sex discrimination.
suit.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a set of clothes made from the same material and including a JACKET (=short coat) and trousers or a skirt
suit.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: someone such as a manager working for a company that produces books, advertisements, or films, and who has to wear a suit when they are at work
